latest.title: Change of name and TIDM
latest.content:
Today 10:49
RNS Number : 5289O
Cykel AI PLC
12 January 2026
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
12 January 2026
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (formerly Cykel AI PLC)
(the "
Company
")
Change of name and TIDM
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC (LSE: DFDV), a Main Market listed company which offers an AI agent platform that enables businesses to automate tasks through the use of specialised digital workers for
sales, recruitment and research and has adopted
a Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy,
is pleased to announce that the Company has changed its name and will trade under its new name DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC with effect from 12 January 2026.
In addition, with effect from 13 January 2026, the Company's TIDM will be amended from "CYK" to "DFDV" on the Main Market of the London Stock Exchange.
The decision to change name to
DeFi Development Corporation UK PLC
reflects the Company's continued development of its Solana focused digital asset treasury strategy as previously announced on 28 August 2025. The "Cykel" trading name will continue to be used for the Company's AI agent activities.
In addition, the Company's website address will also change to www.defidevcorp.co.uk.
Shareholders should note that their shareholdings will be unaffected by the change of name. Existing share certificates should be retained as they will remain valid for all purposes and no new share certificates will be issued.
The Company's ISIN and SEDOL will remain unchanged. The Company's Legal Entity Identifier remains 213800QEO6L6JAS62H02.
The Directors of the Company accept responsibility for this announcement.
*ENDS*
For further information:
Company
Michael Chan
Director
investors@defidevcorp.co.uk
First Sentinel (Corporate Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com

latest.title: Further re warrants
latest.content:
4 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 1455K
Cykel AI PLC
04 December 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
4 December 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("
Cykel AI
" or the "
Company
")
Further re Warrants
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces the following with respect to the warrants, full details of which are set out in the Company's announcement of 28 August 2025.
Warrants cancellation
The Company announces that it has agreed to the cancellation of 5,000,000 Pre-Paid and Investor Warrants (together, the "Warrants"). This will result in the repayment of the deposit already paid for the Pre-Paid Warrants (less a contribution to transaction costs) to the cancelling holders in accordance with the terms of the Warrants. Following this cancellation, the Company has 41,666,667 Warrants outstanding.
Warrants extension details
Under the existing terms, Warrants are not capable of being exercised until certain conditions which are detailed in the 28 August 2025 announcement have been satisfied and would have expired if such conditions were not satisfied by 30 November 2025. The Company and the remaining warrant holders, including DeFi Development Corp, have agreed to extend the period within which these conditions may be satisfied to 1 June 2026. Accordingly, the Warrants will only become exercisable once the relevant conditions have been fulfilled on or before 1 June 2026.
If the conditions have not been satisfied by 1 June 2026, the Warrants will expire and be cancelled and the deposit for the Pre-Paid Warrants will be repaid to the relevant investors (less pre
‑
agreed contributions to transaction costs).
All other terms of the Warrants remain unchanged.
Pre-Paid Warrants and Investor Warrants have the meanings given to them in the announcement published on 28 August 2025.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

latest.title: Changes in Board Composition
latest.content:
3 Nov 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 7828F
Cykel AI PLC
03 November 2025
This announcement contains information which, prior to its disclosure, was inside information as stipulated under Regulation 11 of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019/310 (as amended). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
3 November 2025
Cykel AI PLC
("Cykel AI" or the "Company")
Changes in Board Composition
Cykel AI PLC (LSE:CYK) announces that Nicholas Lyth has resigned as Interim Chairman of the Company, with immediate effect.
The Board would like to take this opportunity to thank Mr. Lyth for his contributions to the Company and wish him well for the future.
Michael Chan will assume the role of Chairman on an interim basis pending the appointment of a Non-executive Chairman in due course.
For further information:
Cykel AI plc
Michael Chan
CEO
investors@cykel.ai
First Sentinel (Financial Adviser)
Brian Stockbridge
brian@first-sentinel.com
+44 (0) 7858 888 007

company_30s.what_they_do: CYK.L is a tech‑focused AI company that builds conversational agents and AI‑driven sales tools for other businesses.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Its products aim to automate sales pipelines, a $30 billion global market that is rapidly shifting to AI‑powered solutions.
company_30s.current_state: The firm is still pre‑revenue, has been raising capital aggressively, and is trying to prove traction through product launches and modest growth figures.

rns_narrative: Listing & Governance: Over the last six months CYK.L has filed a name change, TIDM, a TR1 major‑holding notice, AGM and board‑appointment updates, and a statement on share‑price movement, signalling active engagement with AIM rules.

Capital‑raising push: The company completed a £2.8 million placement in late August, announced a £750 k placing in late May, and issued warrants in December, all aimed at strengthening the balance sheet.

Product & growth milestones: In June the firm unveiled its advanced AI sales agent “Eve”, announced a 68% month‑on‑month growth, and in August launched the GTM AI platform, while signing a commercial agreement with Transpharmation and adopting a Bitcoin treasury reserve strategy.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: The community is split – bulls focus on the rapid product roll‑outs and growth claims, while bears worry about the lack of real revenue, the constant capital‑raise cycle and the absence of any clear valuation anchor.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: Bulls argue the company’s AI platform is ready for market, the 68% MoM growth is a strong signal, and the Bitcoin reserve could create a unique upside if it drives liquidity.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears point out the company has no revenue to show, the price is stuck at essentially zero, and the repeated fund‑raises may dilute existing shareholders without delivering immediate earnings.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: Two weeks ago, a handful of traders were excited by the product launch news, but as the price stayed flat and Google trends remained at zero, sentiment has cooled to cautious.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows no spikes – searches stayed flat at 0/100 for the past month. Social chatter is nil, and the chart quality score sits at 10/21 with zero volatility, confirming the story has lost oxygen.

near_term_catalysts: Q4 results (Oct 30): First revenue print and a detailed cash‑flow forecast. A positive surprise would validate the growth narrative and could lift the price.
Annual report (Jun 2) and AGM (Sep 21): Potential board changes or a vote on a new funding round. A decision to cap dilution or raise more capital will shape the risk profile.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for any sign of revenue recognition, a clear product‑market fit announcement, or a sudden drop in the share price that might trigger a stop‑loss for early traders. Also monitor any director‑selling activity or PDMR filings that could signal a confidence drop.
expect_next.timing_regime: APEX marks CYK.L as a Late‑Stage speculative play – the story has matured but the price remains thin, making entry risky but potentially rewarding if a revenue breakthrough occurs.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Neutral – the narrative is promising but the lack of revenue and flat price action make a decisive bet difficult.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company delivers a first revenue line in Q4 and can demonstrate sustained MoM growth, the AI platform could tap into a huge market and justify a valuation jump. The Bitcoin reserve might also add a speculative lift.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Without any earnings, the price is essentially a zero‑margin gamble. The repeated fund‑raises could dilute shares, and the flat Google trends suggest the market is not buying into the story.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: High risk, potential 3–5x upside if revenue materialises, but the current price and lack of traction make the risk‑reward curve steep.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter a small position (2–3 % of the portfolio) only after a clear revenue announcement or a positive earnings surprise. Use a tight stop at 0.02 p to limit downside, and scale in on subsequent positive catalysts.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until Q4 results are released. If the company reports revenue and a clear go‑to‑market plan, consider a cautious entry on a dip, but avoid buying on speculation alone.
playbook.if_passing: Stay out. The story is too early, the price is flat, and there are no red‑flag signals to justify a speculative bet. Better opportunities exist elsewhere.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Speculative hold – CYK.L offers a potential lottery ticket if it lands a revenue breakthrough, but the flat price, zero Google interest and lack of earnings make it a high‑risk play. Wait for Q4 results before committing any capital.

Historical data shows 1 rallies averaging 370% upside. Current position: +346.9%. Your edge comes from waiting for AI Engine confirmation instead of blind entry.
